title: Artificial intelligence was at the front and centre of COP30
description: We live in a time often characterised as a polycrisis. One of those crises is human-caused climate change, an issue that was discussed by delegates at the COP30 climate talks in Belém, Brazil.

title: AI job interviews and how the technology impacts the job market
description: Artificial intelligence is not only changing the labor market, but also changing the skills required by workers to thrive in it.
content:

title: Prosecutor used flawed AI to keep California man in jail, his lawyers say
description: A California prosecutor's office faces accusations of using artificial intelligence in legal filings. These briefs contained numerous errors, including fake legal citations and misinterpretations of law. Lawyers argue this practice threatens defendants' rights and court legitimacy. Experts warn unchecked AI use could lead to wrongful convictions. The office states it is learning AI's pitfalls and implementing new policies.

title: Alphabet on pace to hit $4 trillion market value as AI gains momentum
description: Alphabet was poised to reach a historic $4 trillion market valuation on Tuesday, driven by a strong year-long surge in its stock. This rally is attributed to the Google parent's intensified focus on artificial intelligence tools, positioning it among Big Tech leaders in the AI race.

title: HP Layoffs: Company to cut 10% of its staff amounting to 6000 employees globally
description: HP Inc. announced on Tuesday that it plans to slash 4,000 to 6,000 jobs worldwide by fiscal 2028, Reuters reported. The move is part of the company’s effort to streamline operations, adopt artificial intelligence, increase product development, improve customer service, and boost productivity. | financialexpress.com

title: Responsible AI: Why it matters now and how to build it right
description: Artificial intelligence should not be about reducing headcount, but used as a force multiplier.
content: Across industries, leaders are racing to automate. Yet every day, we’re reminded that technology alone can’t think critically, empathize, or make moral judgments. In security—and in business more broadly—it’s tempting to embrace AI for its efficiency... [4307 chars]
